column4: how do i remove a program? I ran "make clean" and then "make distclean" as was said in the install file but the folder is still there
I assume you didn't use apt to install it?

why?  You should always use APT whenever possible.  To remove it, you'll have to read tho software's documentation.  Sometimes developers include a "make uninstall" rule.  When they don't you must delete the files yourself
it wasn't a file i could use apt with
it was a FFTW; a Fourier Transform library
there are plenty of those, you're being vague
I installed a newer version but i needed an older version
no, it's available in the repositories
if you want to install it, sure
so what should i type? apt-get 2.1.3?
you can use Software Center if you aren't comfortable using apt-get
back to my 1st question; should i remove the folder fftw-3.2.2? and how?
as I said before: To remove it, you'll have to read tho software's documentation.  Sometimes developers include a "make uninstall" rule.  When they don't you must delete the files yourself
o ic; i can't find the fftw 2.1.3 in the software center; i'll try apt-get
the package name is fftw2.  There's also sfftw2 but I don't know the difference.  You'll have to check that
